message_1: Suppose you intercept a message that has been encrypted using a Caesar cipher, and the letter "A" has been shifted to the letter "D" (i.e. a shift of 3). If the encrypted message reads "LOOIVGFK", what is the original message?
message_2:
To decrypt the message, we need to reverse the Caesar cipher by shifting the letters back by 3 positions. 

L -> I
O -> L
O -> L
I -> F
V -> S
G -> D
F -> C
K -> H

The original message is "ILLFSDCH".
